title: ancient chain segments already extracted
body:
```
eth1_1               | INFO [01-20|18:04:56.739] Opened ancient database                  database=/extra-data/geth
eth1_1               | Fatal: Failed to register the Ethereum service: ancient chain segments already extracted, please set --datadir.ancient to the correct path
eth1_1               | Fatal: Failed to register the Ethereum service: ancient chain segments already extracted, please set --datadir.ancient to the correct path
```

getting this error message. node has been running without issue for awhile. may have started after a system restart. path is correct, on non-full disk, that contains the ancient db
The path of ancient database is `/extra-data/geth`. Can you list this folder? The log says that the ancient database is empty(no entry contained).

@rjl493456442 here ya go

`/extra-data/geth` is mapped to `/mnt/extra-data`
```
root@eth2-mainnet-01:~# ls -la /mnt/extra-data/geth
total 28
drwxr-xr-x 2 root root 4096 Jan 20 17:59 .
drwxr-xr-x 4 root root 4096 Jan 20 17:59 ..
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root    0 Jan 20 17:59 FLOCK
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root    0 Jan 20 17:59 bodies.0000.cdat
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root    6 Jan 20 17:59 bodies.cidx
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root    0 Jan 20 17:59 diffs.0000.rdat
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root    6 Jan 20 17:59 diffs.ridx
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root    0 Jan 20 17:59 hashes.0000.rdat
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root    6 Jan 20 17:59 hashes.ridx
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root    0 Jan 20 17:59 headers.0000.cdat
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root    6 Jan 20 17:59 headers.cidx
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root    0 Jan 20 17:59 receipts.0000.cdat
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root    6 Jan 20 17:59 receipts.cidx
```

not really sure how these files ended up empty :thinking: 
```
root@eth2-mainnet-01:~# du -h /mnt/extra-data/geth/*
0	/mnt/extra-data/geth/FLOCK
0	/mnt/extra-data/geth/bodies.0000.cdat
4.0K	/mnt/extra-data/geth/bodies.cidx
0	/mnt/extra-data/geth/diffs.0000.rdat
4.0K	/mnt/extra-data/geth/diffs.ridx
0	/mnt/extra-data/geth/hashes.0000.rdat
4.0K	/mnt/extra-data/geth/hashes.ridx
0	/mnt/extra-data/geth/headers.0000.cdat
4.0K	/mnt/extra-data/geth/headers.cidx
0	/mnt/extra-data/geth/receipts.0000.cdat
4.0K	/mnt/extra-data/geth/receipts.cidx
```
Transferred over my custom node to DappNode. Deleted the local dat and then set `datadir.ancient`, but received the same error as described in this issue
I created a fresh directory and pointed the flag there, but received a similar error.

same happened to me, using geth 1.10.12 on Ubuntu Server 20

- preloaded chaindata folder via http://api.chaindata.club
- mounted the folder to /mnt/ and symlinked to the datadir

Geth failed to start with error

> Fatal: Failed to register the Ethereum service: ancient chain segments already extracted, please set --datadir.ancient to the correct path

@ChuckNorrison could you please provide some more startup logs preceding that error? 

I have a hunch that symlinking a datadir will work as expected, but let's see what the logs says first.

> @ChuckNorrison could you please provide some more startup logs preceding that error?
> 
> I have a hunch that symlinking a datadir will work as expected, but let's see what the logs says first.

Thanks for your response. Here are some more logs:

> Nov 16 18:45:16 geth-fallback systemd[1]: Started Ethereum Geth Mainnet.
> Nov 16 18:45:16 geth-fallback geth[3115]: INFO [11-16|18:45:16.602] Starting Geth on Ethereum mainnet...
> Nov 16 18:45:16 geth-fallback geth[3115]: INFO [11-16|18:45:16.602] Bumping default cache on mainnet         provided=1024 updated=4096

> Nov 16 18:45:16 geth-fallback geth[3115]: INFO [11-16|18:45:16.605] Smartcard socket not found, disabling    err="stat /run/pcscd/pcscd.comm: no such file or directory"
> Nov 16 18:45:16 geth-fallback geth[3115]: WARN [11-16|18:45:16.605] Option nousb is deprecated and USB is deactivated by default. Use --usb to enable
> Nov 16 18:45:16 geth-fallback geth[3115]: WARN [11-16|18:45:16.606] Sanitizing cache to Go's GC limits       provided=4096 updated=1311
> Nov 16 18:45:16 geth-fallback geth[3115]: INFO [11-16|18:45:16.606] Set global gas cap                       cap=50,000,000
> Nov 16 18:45:16 geth-fallback geth[3115]: INFO [11-16|18:45:16.606] Allocated trie memory caches             clean=196.00MiB dirty=327.00MiB
> Nov 16 18:45:16 geth-fallback geth[3115]: INFO [11-16|18:45:16.606] Allocated cache and file handles         database=/home/nice/.ethereum/mainnet/geth/chaindata cache=653.00MiB handles=262,144
> Nov 16 18:45:24 geth-fallback geth[3115]: INFO [11-16|18:45:24.336] Opened ancient database                  database=/home/nice/.ethereum/mainnet/geth/chaindata/ancient readonly=false
> Nov 16 18:45:24 geth-fallback geth[3115]: Fatal: Failed to register the Ethereum service: ancient chain segments already extracted, please set --datadir.ancient to the correct path
> Nov 16 18:45:24 geth-fallback systemd[1]: geth.service: Main process exited, code=exited, status=1/FAILURE
> Nov 16 18:45:24 geth-fallback systemd[1]: geth.service: Failed with result 'exit-code'.
> Nov 16 18:46:24 geth-fallback systemd[1]: geth.service: Scheduled restart job, restart counter is at 16.
> Nov 16 18:46:24 geth-fallback systemd[1]: Stopped Ethereum Geth Mainnet.

I am getting a very similar issue. 

For context I was using an old raspberry pi 4b to sync a geth node but it had taken over 3.5 weeks and it was still syncing, stuck between 60-100 blocks. So I got a newer raspberry pi 4b with more ram+power; I inserted the microSD card from the old pi to the new one, along with the external 2TB SSD

#### Cmds used to shutdown geth/pi before migrating microSD card + SSD to new more powerful pi
```
sudo systemctl stop geth
sudo shutdown
```

#### Specs
Hardware: `Raspberry pi 4B`
OS: `Ubuntu 21.10`
Geth Version: `1.10.13-stable`
Eth Node directory: `/mnt/ethereum/datadir/mainnet`
Permissions for `/mnt` is set to `ubuntu:ubuntu`



#### This is my Geth service file 
```
## Geth Mainnet service file
[Unit]
Description=Geth Mainnet Node
After=network.target auditd.service
Wants=network.target

[Service]
WorkingDirectory=/mnt/ethereum/datadir/mainnet
ExecStart=sudo /usr/local/bin/geth/geth --syncmode fast --ethash.dagdir /mnt/ethereum/datadir/mainnet/.ethash --datadir /mnt/ethereum/datadir/mainnet --datadir.ancient /mnt/ethereum/mainnet/ --ipcpath /mnt/ethereum/datadir/mainnet/.eth/geth.ipc --verbosity 4 --trace /mnt/ethereum/datadir/mainnet/.trace.log --cache 512 --port 30303 --metrics --maxpeers 100 --mainnet
User=ubuntu
Group=ubuntu
Restart=always
RestartSec=15s

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
Alias=geth.service
```

#### systemd logs

```
Jan  2 23:23:04 ubuntu systemd[1]: Started Geth Mainnet Node.
Jan  2 23:23:05 ubuntu sudo[3969]: INFO [01-02|23:23:05.035] Go tracing started                       dump=/mnt/ethereum/datadir/mainnet/.trace.log
```

```
total 28
```

```
ubuntu@ubuntu:/mnt/ethereum$ ls -la
total 8388652
drwxr-xr-x 7 ubuntu ubuntu       4096 Jan  2 20:06 .
drwxr-xr-x 3 ubuntu ubuntu       4096 Nov 25 04:59 ..
drwxrwxr-x 2 ubuntu ubuntu       4096 Nov 27 20:09 .eth

```
Ive tried pointing `--datadir.ancient` to `/mnt/ethereum/datadir/mainnet/geth/chaindata` but get same error message.
Tried removing `--datadir.ancient` flag all together, from logs: `Opened ancient database                  database=/mnt/ethereum/datadir/mainnet/geth/chaindata/ancient readonly=false` but got same error message.

Anyone see anything obvious?? Corrupted db?? I have no idea what is going on

**Help, Anyone has solved this?** 

```
Feb 28 06:10:27 ip-172-31-44-139 bash[88332]: INFO [02-28|06:10:27.568] Allocated cache and file handles         database=/home/fox/.bor/data/bor/chaindata cache=512.00MiB handles=262,144
```


After reading the source code, I has solved this problem。The reason is very simple, when I unzipped the snapshot file in the background, the process exited suddenly but the unzip process was not finished.  I found many ldb files in the chaindata directory,  also lack many ldb files and the ancient directory. so I unzipped the snapshot file again, then restart with no error message.
